medical_history.chief_complaint: Mild to moderate dull bilaterally lower quadrant/umbilical pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed mild to moderate dull bilateral lower quadrant/umbilical pain post-ERCP that is better with standing up. There were no fevers, chills, nausea, or vomiting, but the patient has had some gas. The pain's duration and specific onset are not detailed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), Hyperlipidemia (HLD), recent laparoscopic to open cholecystectomy complicated by persistent bile leak requiring JP drain.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had cholecystectomy, father had lung cancer, no pancreatic disease, and many family members with breast cancer and lung cancer.
